intro: Oxydectes tetradenia, commonly known as the four-lobed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb that thrives in sandy or rocky soils, often found in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the rainy season. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a distinctive four-lobed shape, giving it its scientific name. Oxydectes tetradenia is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
